docs.title: Main page
docs.text:
Welcome to yet another documentation repository for hackerspace.gent!

This is a work-in-progress effort because the last wiki stopped functioning.

Previous iterations: 1 - 2

docs.title: Hackerspace.gent Infrastructure
docs.text: The infrastructure page includes instructions for some of the commonly used infrastructure in the space.

docs.title: Visitors
docs.text:
Never been to the space? Great, we like new visitors! Here's how to get in:

  • Find our location
  • Consider saying hi on our communications channels
  • It's always a good idea to bring something to do, your laptop, or your pet project
  • Bring friends! Hacking is more fun with others.

docs.title: Contact
docs.text: All different contact details here.

docs.title: Communications channels
docs.text: Method/Channel Address Wiedauwkaai 51, 9000 Ghent, Belgium E-Mail info at 0x20 dottie be Bank Account IBAN: BE68 7310 5962 2134 BIC: KREDBEBB (2024 KBC account) Mattermost chat.hackerspace.gent Mailing list Discussion mailinglist Mastodon @hsg@chaos.social Twitter @hsghent Github https://github.com/0x20/ Onderneming nr 825041616

docs.title: Location
docs.text:
Wiedauwkaai 51, 9000 Ghent, Belgium

Take a look at the map on our website for more details.

docs.title: Infrastructure
docs.text: You can add quick and dirty sections here, or you can add a new page in the Infra folder and update the mkdocs.yml to register the page in the menu.

docs.title: Register a new user
docs.text:
Steps to create a new bar account for a new member:

  1. Update the members.beancount file on Github/0x20/tab-data/static/members.beancount
  2. Important: the membername is case-sensitive and has to start with an uppercase!
  3. Add the new user and add mm_name to receive barbot Mattermost message for each transaction. Example commit
  4. Press the 'Sync' button on the bar display
  5. The new account should be available on the very end of the list

docs.title: Register a new user
docs.text:
1. create a new user on the UDM Pro and put the new user in the Hackerspace Members group
  2. click the button to register an NFC tag, and swipe it on the correct reader when the system tells you to do. This can be done either locally (gateway IP) or through the remote control panel https://unifi.ui.com. Data is stored locally, and it doesn't need internet or a cloud service to work.

It's fail open for fire safety because we do not have any other way to exit.

docs.title: Drinks
docs.text:
An overview of ClubMate sellers: https://lite.framacalc.org/hs-gent-clubmate-2024

Note: the address of Durstlöscher Aachen is not the retail location! Check this before leaving.

docs.title: Electricity
docs.text: De zekeringkast voor ons licht is in dit lokaal: zekeringen 12 en 13. Aan onze deur zijn het 4 enkelpolige schakelaars.

docs.title: Doorbell
docs.text:
Very straightforward implementation:

  • A ring the bell button on https://hackerspace.gent/landing/contact.php that writes a file on disk containing a timestamp
  • A cronjob on the Pi (pi@10.51.3.195) that is connected to the flappers that checks every x amount of seconds if a new file is written
  • When an updated timestamp if found, instruct the flappers

docs.title: Garbage bins
docs.text: Ikea Knockla, needs 50 liter trash bags

docs.title: disposal
docs.text: In the big hal

docs.title: 2D Printer
docs.text: A Samsung M4020nd printer is available in the space (donated by TQ and Johan for the paper). DNS: hsgprinter.lan.0x20.be

docs.title: MacOS
docs.text: Settings -> Printer -> Add printer -> Samsung M332x 382x 402x Series (SEC30CDA71FA048)

docs.title: Ubuntu
docs.text: Printers -> magic happens -> it's already there

docs.title: Windows
docs.text: Download the driver here, and follow the instructions.

docs.title: Bambulab mini
docs.text:
This printer is property of mateo and miker, but free to use if you know what you're doing (if not, ask help).

The printer is configured in LAN-only mode, and can be accessed on the network via OrcaSlicer software. Install the proprietary network plugin, click on Device, click on add printer. Don't choose "Add with PIN code" and instead go to "Other Devices" and select the "hackerspace bamboo mini".

After that it asks for a 8 digit PIN that you can find in Settings > Lan Only Mode.

DNS: bambu-mini.lan.0x20.be

docs.title: Prusa Mk3s+
docs.text: This printer is space property (also paid for by members), can be used freely if you know what you're doing (if not, ask help).

docs.title: Stadsmakers
docs.text: There is an internal website used by Stadsmakers with info for the coop's. See the SpaceMembers mattermost channel info header to find the link. Not posting the link here as it contains private data.
